result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Vanessa Jo Seymour

defendant.name: Seymour, Vanessa Jo
defendant.address: E 3183 County Road P, Menomonie, WI 54751

records.addlTxt: 2:39 PM CO: Vlack, DAR: Gross, Clerk: K Kittel. District Attorney Karl E Anderson in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Jon Elton Stanek appeared by video for Vanessa Jo Seymour. Defendant Vanessa Jo Seymour in court. V/W and JSC present. Atty Stankek argues bond modification to allow DE to go to Dunn Co. DA Anderson responds. Victim makes statements. Court responds, questions DE. Court states that DE is to provide a letter from the farm owner (with address and phone number) where she will be working and residing. If that is provided, the court would amend the bond. Court notes the placement order on 22FA147 to remain in effect. When DA's office verifies DE living and working at the farm, bond will be amended and DE would have to come in and sign the new bond. Adjourned:  2:48 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on November 4, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Filed by Atty Stanek. arc    Per EFV, BBH scheduled with attys. gll

Order for payment on December 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
DE had already pd Dec & Jan on 10/21/22. Noted on her copy of the PPA. jaf
on behalf of DE. olg   To GL

FOR ATTY FEES. DE to pay $50/mo comm 12/1/22. PPF waived. DE signed Pet for Appt of Atty & will be mailed an Order for Pymt. jaf

Status conference on October 17, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

DE called stating she lost her job because she can't leave the county and needs to update her petition for appointment of counsel. JA advised DE that she can file a new petition with the updated information. DE also requested to speak to the judge. JA advised she can't speak to the judge unless there's a hearing, otherwise she can write a letter to the judge. DE asked for a sooner hearing than 10/18. JA again advised she would need to write a letter for the judge to consider.  gll
Filed by Hubbard House, re DE's eligibility. olg   To GL

records.addlTxt:
**AMENDED**

- Contact with child pursuant to case 22FA147. 

- I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to be fitted with a GPS monitoring device (Defendant must remain in St. Croix County). Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. 

If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

Rec'd a call from a female identifying herself as a friend of the court regarding warrant. Clerk advised that the DA filed a complaint and warrant, which was reviewed and signed by the judge. Caller asked about the legality of the warrant. Clerk advised caller that the clerk's office is the record keeper and cannot give legal advise. Caller was transferred to DA's office.  gll
